Authors: T. K. Goh, Sung-Yuan Hsieh, Chang-Hsin Kuo
Title:
A revision of the genus Vanakripa, with description of two
new species from Taiwan
Keywords:
Asexual freshwater fungi, Fuscosporellales,
Hypocreomycetidae, lignicolous fungi, phylogeny, Sordariomycetes,
sporodochial hyphomycetes, taxonomy
Abstract:
Vanakripa oblonga sp. nov. and V. taiwanensis sp. nov. are
described from decaying wood submerged in freshwater streams of Taoyuan
District, Kaohsiung City, Taiwan. The phylogenetic relationship of
Vanakripa species was sought among representative taxa from related
fungal ordinal lineage, namely the Conioscyphales, Fuscosporellales,
Pleurotheciellales and Savoryellales, by comparing the sequences of
their nuc rDNA ITS1-5.8S-ITS2 (ITS barcode). Based on phylogenetic
relationship and morphological comparison, V. moniliformis comb. nov.
and V. mucosa comb. nov. are proposed, which are transferred from
Parafuscosporella moniliformis and P. mucosa, respectively. Vanakripa
ellipsoidea is re-typified by designating its lectotype. New terminology
is used to describe conidial shapes of Vanakripa species and a key to
the 13 accepted species is given.
